intro: Diastema galeopsis, commonly known as field penny-cress, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features alternate, pinnately compound leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are followed by pod-like fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a common weed in agricultural settings.
